FRN101.name: Elementary French I
FRN101.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FRN101.description: Practice in using and understanding French to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.

FRN102.name: Elementary French II
FRN102.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN102.description: Further practice in using and understanding French to develop listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Pronunciation, grammar, vocabulary, and cultural topics.
FRN102.prerequisite: (FRN 101) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN103.name: Intensive Elementary French Abroad I
FRN103.description: Build foundations for continued development in competency in the spoken and written French language through a variety of texts, videos, and multimedia to present contemporary culture in the French-speaking world.

FRN104.name: Intensive Elementary French Abroad II
FRN104.description: Expand knowledge to ensure continued development in competency in the spoken and written French language through a variety of texts, videos, and multimedia to present contemporary culture in the French-speaking world.
FRN104.prerequisite: (FRN 101 or FRN 103) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN201.name: Second-Year French I
FRN201.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN201.description: Intermediate-level review and development of aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the French-speaking world.
FRN201.prerequisite: (FRN 102 or FRN 150) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN202.name: Second-Year French II
FRN202.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN202.description: Further review and development of aural comprehension, speaking, reading, and writing skills. Topics in the cultures of the French-speaking world.

FRN203.name: Intensive Intermediate French Abroad I
FRN203.description: Develop ability to produce more authentic and more accurate French speech, to comprehend more sophisticated structures in written and oral form, and to broaden understanding of contemporary culture and society in the French-speaking world through a variety of texts, videos, and multimedia.
FRN203.prerequisite: (FRN 102 or FRN 104) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN204.name: Intensive Intermediate French Abroad II
FRN204.prerequisite: (FRN 201 or FRN 203) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN290.name: Independent Study
FRN290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

FRN320.name: Self-Expression in Writing (W)
FRN320.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN320.description: Writing practice in a variety of forms. Reading of excerpts from French and Francophone literature in order to enrich vocabulary and analyze style. Grammar review.
FRN320.prerequisite: ((FRN 202) or designated score on French Placement test ) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

FRN321.name: Oral Expression
FRN321.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN321.description: Present-day spoken French. Discussions on various aspects of French culture and social interaction, mastery of advanced vocabulary. Readings chosen from current magazines and newspapers and complemented by Web exercises and video materials.
FRN321.prerequisite: (FRN 202) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN330.name: French Phonetics
FRN330.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN330.description: Analysis of French pronunciation for listening and speaking.
FRN330.prerequisite: (FRN 202) or designated score on French Placement test

FRN340.name: Introduction to Reading French Literature (W)
FRN340.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN340.description: Close reading and interpretation of French drama, poetry, fiction, and other prose forms.
FRN340.prerequisite: (FRN 202 and FRN 320) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

FRN400.name: Reading French for Graduate Students
FRN400.description: Intensive study of French for graduate students needing a reading knowledge of the language.
FRN400.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.

FRN415.name: Introduction to French Studies I: Metropolitan France
FRN415.description: Aspects of the culture of France in its many manifestations

FRN416.name: Introduction to French Studies II: Francophone Cultures
FRN416.description: Exploration of French culture in the Francophone world outside metropolitan France.

FRN425.name: Advanced Studies in French Language
FRN425.description: To broaden advanced students' capacities for self-expression. Accurate form and appropriate expression through translation, composition, or creative writing. Examination of contrasting styles of expression in view of developing nuances.

FRN430.name: French Linguistics
FRN430.description: Key issues in French linguistics and contrastive structures of French and English.

FRN445.name: Theme-Based Seminar
FRN445.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year

FRN446.name: History-Based Seminar
FRN446.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN446.description: Organized by century or artistic period. Examination of the historical, intellectual, and artistic climate surrounding texts.

FRN447.name: Genre-Based Seminar
FRN447.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN447.description: Based on significant literary or artistic genre such as poetry, novel, short story, essay, theater, film or musical theater from either a synchronic or diachronic perspective.

FRN490.name: Independent Study
FRN490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
FRN490.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

FRN491.name: Special Topics in French
FRN491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
FRN491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis.
FRN491.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

FRN492.name: Senior Writing Project
FRN492.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FRN492.description: Research and preparation of a paper on an interdisciplinary subject that synthesizes at least three areas of a major's undergraduate education. Students work under the supervision of a faculty member.
FRN492.restrictions: Open to seniors in the French major.

FRN800.name: Reading French
FRN800.description: Intensive study of French for students needing a reading knowledge of the language. Focus on reading comprehension of French and translation into English.
FRN800.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and not open to sophomores or approval of department.

FRN805.name: Evolution of the French Language
FRN805.description: Diachronic examination of the phonological, morphological, and syntactic developments of French as it evolved from Latin.

FRN806.name: Topics in French Linguistics
FRN806.description: Key issues in theoretical and applied French linguistics. Syntax, morphology, phonology, and semantics. Foreign language acquisition.

FRN815.name: Studies in 16th-Century French Literature
FRN815.description: Works of major prose writers and poets of the Renaissance and Reformation.

FRN825.name: Studies in 18th-Century French Literature
FRN825.description: Works of major writers of the French Enlightenment.

FRN830.name: Studies in 19th Century Literature
FRN830.description: Major authors and selected topics in poetry, prose, and drama of the nineteenth century.
FRN830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the French major or in the French, Language and Literature major.

FRN835.name: Studies in 20th Century Literature
FRN835.description: Spiritual, intellectual, psychological, and aesthetic conflicts in texts with world-wide impact.
FRN835.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the French major or in the French, Language and Literature major.

FRN850.name: Introduction to Critical Theory
FRN850.description: Fundamentals of critical theory emphasizing the evolution of French and Francophone thought. Topics such as structuralism, deconstruction, post-modernism, feminism, post-colonialism, epistemology, psychology, and ethics.

FRN855.name: Interdisciplinary Topics in Film Studies
FRN855.description: Topics in film studies that engage other disciplines and fields through historical, cultural, and formal content.

FRN890.name: Independent Study
FRN890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FRN890.description: Special projects, directed reading, and research arranged by an individual graduate student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

FRN891.name: Special Topics in French
FRN891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FRN891.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group-study basis.

FRN893.name: Interdisciplinary Seminar
FRN893.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
FRN893.description: Examination of a theme, topic, or genre from several different national and disciplinary perspectives in the appropriate cultural and socio-historical context. Significant texts and important critical analysis selected from Great Britain, Spain, France, Germany, the Americas, and others.

FRN897.name: Master's Examination
FRN897.description: A written and an oral master's examination based on course work and the individual reading list, with specific focus area(s) to be determined in consultation with the faculty.

FRN898.name: Master's Research Project
FRN898.description: Research-based project with pedagogical or other practical application (e.g., software, innovative teaching modules, video).

FRN899.name: Master’s Thesis Research
FRN899.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Arts and Letters or in the Department of Romance and Classical Studies or in the French Major.

FRN999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
FRN999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
